1.name: The Wizard of Oz
1.description: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

2.name: Gone with the Wind
2.description: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

3.name: Stagecoach
3.description: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

4.name: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
4.description: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

5.name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
5.description: In 15th century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.

6.name: Trouble in Sundown
6.description: The bank has been robbed, the night watchman killed and the safe opened. The townspeople want John as he was the only one with the combination. Clint gets John out of town but before the ...                See full summary »

7.name: Wuthering Heights
7.description: A servant in the house of Wuthering Heights tells a traveller the unfortunate tale of lovers Cathy and Heathcliff.

8.name: Jamaica Inn
8.description: In Cornwall, 1819, a young woman discovers she's living near a gang of criminals who arrange shipwrecks for profit.

9.name: Son of Frankenstein
9.description: One of the sons of Frankenstein finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor who is bent on revenge.

10.name: The Cat and the Canary
10.description: When an eccentric family meets in their uncle's remote, decaying mansion on the tenth anniversary of his death for the reading of his will, murder and madness follow.

11.name: La règle du jeu
11.description: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

12.name: The Women
12.description: A study of the lives and romantic entanglements of various interconnected women.

13.name: Of Mice and Men
13.description: Two itinerant migrant workers, one mentally disabled and the other his carer, take jobs as ranch hands during the Great Depression to fulfill their shared dream of owning their own ranch.

14.name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
14.description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate the legend of a supernatural hound, a beast that may be stalking a young heir on the fog-shrouded moorland that makes up his estate.

15.name: Ninotchka
15.description: A stern Russian woman sent to Paris on official business finds herself attracted to a man who represents everything she is supposed to detest.

16.name: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
16.description: An aged teacher and former headmaster of a boarding school recalls his career and his personal life over the decades.

17.name: Destry Rides Again
17.description: When a tough western town needs taming, the mild-mannered son of a hard-nosed sheriff gets the job.

18.name: The Little Princess
18.description: A little girl is left by her father in an exclusive seminary for girls, due to her father having to go to South Africa to fight in the Second Boer War.

19.name: Let's Be Famous
19.description: An Irishman sets out to become famous as a singer on the radio. Due to a mix up he is instead entered as a contestant on a quiz show. He causes mayhem in the studio and the publicity ...                See full summary »

20.name: Nancy Drew and the Hidden Staircase
20.description: Nancy helps two aging spinsters fulfill the byzantine provisions of their father's will, but the murder of their chauffeur complicates matters.

21.name: Love Affair
21.description: A French playboy and an American former nightclub singer fall in love aboard a ship. They arrange to reunite six months later, after he has had a chance to earn a decent living.

22.name: Dark Victory
22.description: A young socialite is diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumor, and must decide whether or not she'll meet her final days with dignity.

23.name: They Made Me a Criminal
23.description: A boxer flees believing he has comitted a murder while he was drunk.

24.name: Beau Geste
24.description: Three adopted English brothers join the French Foreign Legion in North Africa, after one of them steals their adoptive family's famous heirloom sapphire.

25.name: Gunga Din
25.description: In 19th century India, three British soldiers and a native waterbearer must stop a secret mass revival of the murderous Thuggee cult before it can rampage across the land.

26.name: Babes in Arms
26.description: A group of vaudevillians struggling to compete with talkies hits the road hoping for a comeback. Frustrated to be left behind, all of their kids put on a show themselves to raise money for the families and to prove they've got talent, too.

27.name: Only Angels Have Wings
27.description: At a remote South American trading port, the manager of an air freight company is forced to risk his pilots' lives in order to win an important contract.

28.name: The Roaring Twenties
28.description: Three men attempt to make a living in Prohibitionist America after returning home from fighting together in World War I.

29.name: The Flying Deuces
29.description: Ollie has fallen in love with the innkeeper's daughter in Paris. The only problem - she's very much in love with her husband. To forget her he joins the Foreign Legion with Stan. Bad idea.

30.name: Gulliver's Travels
30.description: A doctor washes ashore on an island inhabited by little people.

31.name: Tower of London
31.description: In the 15th century Richard Duke of Gloucester, aided by his club-footed executioner Mord, eliminates those ahead of him in succession to the throne, then occupied by his brother King ...                See full summary »

32.name: Young Mr. Lincoln
32.description: A fictionalized account of the early life of the American president as a young lawyer facing his greatest court case.

33.name: Union Pacific
33.description: In 1862, Central Pacific and Union Pacific Railroads compete westward across the wilderness toward California.

34.name: The Four Feathers
34.description: A timid British Army officer has quit and burns his last day summons to a war in Egypt. Calling him a coward, his girl friend and 3 officer friends give him a white feather. In redemption, he shadows his friends in war to save their lives.

35.name: Jesse James
35.description: After railroad agents forcibly evict the James family from their family farm, Jesse and Frank turn to banditry for revenge.

36.name: Made for Each Other
36.description: While on a business trip, an ambitious young lawyer meets and immediately falls in love with a stranger. They wed the following day, and tragedy soon strikes.

37.name: Dodge City
37.description: A Texas cattle agent witnesses first hand, the brutal lawlessness of Dodge City and takes the job of sheriff to clean the town up.

38.name: Le jour se lève
38.description: After committing a murder, a man locks himself in his apartment and recollects the events that led him to the killing.

39.name: The Story of Alexander Graham Bell
39.description: The story of how Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone.

40.name: Drums Along the Mohawk
40.description: Newlyweds Gil and Lana Martin try to establish a farm in the Mohawk Valley but are menaced by Indians and Tories as the Revolutionary War begins.

41.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
41.description: Despotic King Louis XIV discovers he has a twin brother who has grown up under the tutelage of his foster father, the patriotic musketeer D'Artagnan.

42.name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
42.description: The master sleuth hunts his archenemy, Professor Moriarty, who is planning the crime of the century.

43.name: Zenobia
43.description: A modest country doctor in the antebellum South has to contend with his daughter's upcoming marriage and an affectionate medicine show elephant.

44.name: Another Thin Man
44.description: An explosives manufacturer suspects a young man is out to kill him. He calls in new parents Nick and Nora to sort things out.

45.name: At the Circus
45.description: The Marx Brothers try to help the owner of a circus recover some stolen funds before he finds himself out of a job.

46.name: Intermezzo: A Love Story
46.description: A concert violinist becomes charmed with his daughter's talented piano teacher. When he invites her to go on tour with him, they make beautiful music away from the concert hall as well. He ...                See full summary »

47.name: Golden Boy
47.description: Despite his musical talent, Joe Bonaparte wants to be a boxer.

48.name: A Chump at Oxford
48.description: As a reward for capturing a bank robber, Stan and Ollie get scholarship to Oxford, but are met with resentment by other students.

49.name: Walang sugat
49.description: Regarded as Severino Reyes' masterpiece, "Walang Surgat" broadly underscores the injustice of Spanish rule even as it dances around the cruel fate of the young lovers Tenyong and Julia with...                See full summary »

50.name: Buck Rogers
50.description: A 20th Century pilot named Buck Rogers and his young friend Buddy Wade awake from 500 years in suspended animation to find that the world has been taken over by the outlaw army of Killer Kane.
